newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-INJURED GILCHRIST AWAITS RESULT OF KNEE SCAN.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-INJURED GILCHRIST AWAITS RESULT OF KNEE SCAN.

text.p: Australia are awaiting the result of a scan on reserve wicket-keeper Adam Gilchrist's injured knee before deciding whether to send him home, coach Geoff Marsh said on Friday.

Another team official had said earlier that Gilchrist was definitely flying home to Australia but Marsh said the player would undergo examination at a Manchester hospital before a final decision was made.
Gilchrist, who injured remedial ligaments during practice for the third test at Old Trafford, has had little chance to make an impression on the tour, playing only one innings.
But he played on the previous tour of South Africa as a specialist batsman and there had been suggestions that he might be brought into the test team in that role if Michael Bevan failed again.
Bevan made only seven in the third test on Thursday and has scored just 43 in four test innings.
